p: At 20 °C, the fast-growth life strategy was validated for B. hordeaceus because RGR and NP max were almost twice as high as for B. erectus (Figs. 1, 2), C:N ratio was very low, and LMA significantly lower than for B.erectus (T-test: t = 5.6, df = 8, p < 0.005). The more conservative life traits were shown by B. erectus supporting a slow-growth strategy in this species.
